CANDIDATE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[725, 241, 907, 285]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 306, 220, 321]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 327, 356, 344]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2 (P2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 460, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 782, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 320, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 539, 910, 570]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions in the space provided. If additional space is required, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet. The question number(s) must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 570, 910, 600]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 600, 598, 615]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 615, 606, 630]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 644, 608, 660]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 660, 756, 676]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 676, 440, 691]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 390, 92]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\operatorname {f}(x)\) is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[371, 100, 625, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\operatorname {f}(x) = x^{4} - 3x^{3} + 5x^{2} - 6x + 11.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 127, 641, 147]]<|/det|>
Find the quotient and remainder when \(\operatorname {f}(x)\) is divided by \((x^{2} + 2)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 127, 920, 146]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 73, 156, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 73, 450, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(|4x + 5| = |x - 7|.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 549, 186, 567]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 548, 920, 584]]<|/det|>
Hence, using logarithms, solve the equation \(|2^{y + 2} + 5| = |2^{y} - 7|\), giving the answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 562, 920, 581]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[336, 87, 693, 285]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 306, 920, 355]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(y = kx^{a}\), where \(k\) and \(a\) are constants. The graph of \(\ln y\) against \(\ln x\) is a straight line passing through the points (0.22, 3.96) and (1.32, 2.43), as shown in the diagram. Find the values of \(k\) and \(a\) correct to 3 significant figures. [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 428, 92]]<|/det|>
The sequence \(x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3}, \ldots\) defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 102, 599, 133]]<|/det|>
\[x_{1} = 1,\quad x_{n + 1} = \frac{x_{n}}{\ln(2x_{n})}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 142, 319, 160]]<|/det|>
converges to the value \(\alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 173, 156, 191]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 173, 920, 207]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula to find the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 4 significant figures. Give the result of each iteration to 6 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 191, 920, 208]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 560, 186, 579]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 560, 742, 579]]<|/det|>
State an equation satisfied by \(\alpha\) and hence determine the exact value of \(\alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 561, 920, 579]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 85, 96, 104]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 84, 148, 103]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 391, 117]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\int_{2}^{18} \frac{3}{2x} \, \mathrm{d}x = \ln 27.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 84, 920, 102]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 448, 186, 467]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 438, 722, 476]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{6}\pi} 4 \sin^{2}\left(\frac{3}{2} x\right) \mathrm{d}x\). Show all necessary working.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 451, 920, 470]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 437, 92]]<|/det|>
The parametric equations of a curve are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[371, 100, 623, 119]]<|/det|>
\[x = 3\sin 2\theta ,\quad y = 1 + 2\tan 2\theta ,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 127, 240, 145]]<|/det|>
for \(0\leqslant \theta < \frac{1}{4}\pi .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 163, 156, 180]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 163, 680, 181]]<|/det|>
Find the exact gradient of the curve at the point for which \(\theta = \frac{1}{6}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 163, 920, 181]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\theta\) at the point where the gradient of the curve is 2, giving the value correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 74, 161, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Express \(0.5 \cos \theta - 1.2 \sin \theta\) in the form \(R \cos (\theta + \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0^\circ < \alpha < 90^\circ\), giving the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 596, 191, 613]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 596, 712, 615]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(0.5 \cos \theta - 1.2 \sin \theta = 0.8\) for \(0^\circ < \theta < 360^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 594, 920, 613]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
